{{also|北京}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|北|north}} + {{zh-l|平|peace, pacification}}, used in the sense of pacified or conquered territory.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=Běipíng
|c=bak1 ping4
|mn=Pak-pêng
|cat=pn
}}

===Proper noun===
{{zh-proper noun}}

# {{lb|zh|archaic}} Beiping [[w:Commandery|Commandery]] (in present-day [[w:Baoding|Baoding]], [[Hebei]])
# {{lb|zh|historic}} [[Beiping]], the name of [[Beijing]] during the early [[Ming]] [[dynasty]], between its conquest by the [[Hongwu]] [[emperor]] and its renaming by the [[Yongle]] emperor
# {{lb|zh|historic}} [[Beiping]], the name of [[Beijing]] during the early [[20th century]] when the [[Republic of China]] removed its capital to [[Nanking]]

====Usage notes====
In the third sense, the most common English usage is [[Peiping]], [[Pei-ping]], or [[P'ei-ping]], all based on the Wade-Giles romanization of Chinese characters which was commonly used in English during this period of Chinese history.
